content: This information will be displayed in the <1>{{link}}</1> window.

comment.text: "This translation key is used for the description displayed when the Company Information settings are unavailable. It is typically shown in a popup or modal window and informs users where to find more information about the company."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic text includes `<1> {{link}} </1>` which mirrors the English structure. While technically correct, it's unusual to retain the HTML-like tags in the translated content. It's recommended to remove them for better readability unless the application specifically requires them.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: سيتم عرض هذه المعلومات في النافذة {{link}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'pəncərəsində' should be 'təyin ediləcək' to more accurately reflect 'window' in this context.  'Pəncərəsində' literally means 'in the window' which isn't the intended meaning.
The formatting of the tag <1>{{link}}</1> is consistent between the English and Bulgarian versions, but it's important to ensure it renders correctly in the target platform's UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify proper rendering of <1>{{link}}</1> in the UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation maintains the `<1>{{link}}</1>` tags exactly as in the English, which might not be ideal for readability or expected formatting in a Greek interface.  It's better to review if the tag's placement and appearance are correct in the intended UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the intended UI to ensure the `<1>{{link}}</1>` tag is correctly rendered in Greek and adjust the formatting accordingly. Consider if a different tag or formatting style might be more appropriate.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'informaatio' is a less common and slightly formal way of saying 'information'. 'Tietoa' would be a more natural and common choice in this context.

The phrase 'This information will be displayed' is better translated as 'Cette information sera affichée' or 'Ces informations seront affichées' depending on the intended plural/singular agreement. The current translation, 'Ces informations seront affichées,' is grammatically correct but may be slightly more formal than intended.  'Cette information sera affichée' would also be valid.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Cette information sera affichée' or 'Cette information sera présentée' for a potentially more natural or less formal tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian translation 'Queste informazioni verranno visualizzate nella finestra <1>{{link}}</1>.' is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Italian. 'Queste informazioni' (These information) is awkward. It would be more natural to say 'Le informazioni...' or 'Questi dati...'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Le informazioni verranno visualizzate nella finestra <1>{{link}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation maintains the `<1>{{link}}</1>` tag, which is likely intended to be rendered as a link. This should be verified during implementation to ensure proper link functionality.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm that the `<1>{{link}}</1>` tag is rendered correctly in the Korean UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation has a missing closing tag `</1>` after the `{{link}}` placeholder.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຂໍ້ມູນນີ້ຈະຖືກສະແດງຢູ່ໃນປ່ອງຢ້ຽມ <1>{{link}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English 'window' is better translated as 'izmērs' or 'pavirša' in this context, as it refers to a display area or pane rather than a physical window.
The HTML tags <1> and </1> are unusual. They should be clarified or removed if they don't represent a specific formatting requirement.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider clarifying the purpose of the <1> and </1> tags, or replace them with a more standard HTML structure if applicable. If they are meant to be placeholders, the system consuming this text needs to be aware of this.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Deze informatie wordt weergegeven in het venster' is not the most natural way to express 'This information will be displayed in the window'. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Deze informatie is te zien in het venster'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Deze informatie is te zien in het venster

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Dana informacja wyświetli się' is not the most natural or accurate rendering of 'This information will be displayed'. 'Dana' implies something is given or offered, which isn't the intended meaning.  A more accurate translation would use a verb implying showing or appearing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Informacja ta będzie widoczna w oknie <1>{{link}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Essas' (These) implies a previous reference. 'This information' refers to a single piece of information, so 'Esta' would be more accurate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Esta informação será exibida na janela <1>{{link}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'window' is translated as 'කවුළුවෙහි'. A more natural and common translation for 'window' in this context would be 'විනුඩුව' (vinuduwa). 'කවුළුවෙහි' implies a more specific type of window or enclosure.

The English phrase 'window' is best translated to 'prozor' in Serbian (Cyrillic) in this context. While 'prozor' is present, the phrasing implies a more general 'display' instead of a specific window.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ова информација ће бити приказана у <1>{{link}}</1> прозору.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are present in both the English and Serbian translations. While technically correct, it might be more natural to remove these tags unless their presence is functionally important for the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider whether the tags are necessary. If not, remove them from the Serbian translation: "Ova informacija će biti prikazana u {{link}} prozoru."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Thông tin này sẽ được hiển thị trong cửa sổ <1>{{link}}</1>.' is a literal translation and while understandable, it could be improved for natural flow.  'Cửa sổ' (window) is correct but can sound slightly formal in this context. A more natural phrasing might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Thông tin này sẽ được hiển thị trong <1>{{link}}</1>.
